title: EastEnders star promises more huge shocks after major Ash twist
text:
Iqra Ahmed (Priya Davdra) has been growing increasingly frustrated with girlfriend Ash’s (Gurlaine Kaur Garcha) refusal to discuss her family in EastEnders, but tonight’s episode revealed a major twist, as Ash’s siblings turned out to be none other than Kheerat (Jaz Deol), Jags (Amar Adatia) and Vinny (Shiv Jalota) Panesar.

The Panesars arrived in Walford tonight with a mission, as they searched high and low for their sister. However, it was later revealed that this sister they were so desperately searching for was none other than Ash.

Kheerat, Jags and Vinny split up to look for their sibling, and — after recognising Habiba (Rukku Nahar) from Ash’s social media, it was Vinny that managed to locate Ash— much to her dismay.

Faced with no other choice but to confront her past, Ash took Vinny to the park for a catch-up, and — via their conversation — it was revealed that the family had been incredibly tough on Ash four years earlier — which is the reason why she cut all contact with them.

On Ash’s decision to keep her family at arm’s length, actress Gurlaine Kaur Garcha said: ‘Ash knows her family aren’t going to approve of Iqra so is trying to protect her relationship.

Advertisement

Advertisement

She’s come away from her family and is living on her own but knows when her brothers are involved, all her independence goes so she’s desperately trying to keep in control. She’s also trying to make Iqra understand without actually saying what the issue is.’

Before departing, Vinny informed Ash that their mum is dying of cancer — which is why they’re so desperate to get the family back together —but Ash refused to come home, so Vinny respected her wishes and thus lied to his brothers about being unable to find her.

While the Panesar brothers seemingly took yet another leave of absence from the Square, this is only just the beginning of what promises to be yet another thrilling EastEnders storyline.

Speaking about what’s to come for the clan, Gurlaine said: ‘I am so excited, there is definitely going to be some shocks along the way. The Panesars are exactly what a normal Punjabi family is like! Viewers are going to be glued to their screen and there is definitely going to be some ‘doof doofs’!

Regardless of what Ash said, it’s pretty clear that she’s conflicted over what to do for the best — and remains uncertain of how much to tell Iqra about her family.

Speaking of Iqra, it seems as if there’s plenty more to come for the pair, as Gurlaine teased: ‘I think it will be a bit of a rollercoaster. I definitely think it’s going to be exciting and interesting to see how Ash handles her brothers meeting Iqra for the first time. I really hope it’s a happy ending for them and they’re together forever – but it is EastEnders after all!’

Advertisement

Advertisement

EastEnders continues Thursday 31stOctober at 7:30pm on BBC One.

description: There's plenty more to come for Ash — and the Panesars — after tonight's shocking reveal.
